featured.text: Abraham Lincoln did the same, but then the inaugural crowds became far too large for the White House to accommodate comfortably, and this also created a security issue.
Kauai is not for people who thrive on crowds or nightlife.
It was not until Grover Cleveland’s first presidency that some effective crowd control measures were implemented to address the problem caused by this practice.
The huge crowd of people around him.

other.text: They crowd the classrooms at Bekoji Elementary School, where Eshetu works as a physical-education instructor.
The theater would not be as crowded the second night.
Your desk is crowded with too many unnecessary things.

definition.zh_def: 一群人聚集在一起，通常在某個地方或事件中。
definition.en_def: A large number of people gathered together, typically in a public place.
definition.example: The crowd cheered as the band took the stage.
